wikipedia_page.main:
Shelley Rae (born 1 June 1976) is a former English female rugby union player. She represented England at the 2002 Women's Rugby World Cup, and 2006 Women's Rugby World Cup. 
She scored her first try in 2001 when England beat New Zealand 22-17 in Auckland, a side that previously went undefeated for 10 years. She also won the IRB Female Player of the Year Award in 2001. She competed at the 2002 Women's Rugby World Cup finishing second.Rae retired from international rugby in 2008.She played for Shelford rugby club . and London Wasps .

response: *IRB International Women's Player of the Year: Shelley Rae

Wasps Women have provided a number of players for international teams. Sue Day and Shelley Rae played for both Wasps Women and the England women's national rugby union team. Stephanie Te Ohaere-Fox played for both Wasps Women and the New Zealand women's national rugby union team.
